The Sexualisation of a Society

I Would like to first start this essay with a word from the bible Genisis 1:27 
“So God created man in his own image,
    in the image of God he created him;
    male and female he created them.”

In this age of social media and age of technology there has been a prevalent rise in sexualisation throughout the world as it can be seen almost everywhere now, fashion, movies, actors, our daily content/media and even in dating. This progress has been seen as liberating and encouraging freedom for women and those who speak against it has been labelled as a backward thinking human. However, I would like to say the opposite as it has caused massive damages to men and women in dating, communications and mental health destroying the mental health of so many men and objectifying women to become a product instead of a real person. This type of content sexualisation has been propagated and marketed carefully by the corporate and business industry to sell more of their product to fuel their competition and their everlasting attempt to dominate the market yet forgetting the ethics of it.
